metadata.title: CVE-2024-41996 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Validating the order of the public keys in the Diffie-Hellman Key AgreementProtocol, when an approved safe prime is used, allows remote attackers(from the client side) to trigger unnecessarily expensive server-side DHEmodular-exponentiation calculations. The client may cause asymmetricresource consumption. The basic attack scenario is that the client mustclaim that it can only communicate with DHE, and the server must beconfigured to allow DHE and validate the order of the public key.

criterions.comment: openssl package in fips-updates/xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2024-09-06').
